title: Making the CuteCats package

Additional, optional folders files serve purposes. data folder allows data specific types files (csv, rda). inst directory added package installed; good place add supplementary files needed package don’t fit data folder. files cute little PANDA package might look like:

title: Making the CuteCats package
text: can include functions package writing saving R directory. file can contain one functions. names files don’t matter much, file must end .R. example, open new R script RStudio create love_cats(). second function, let’s take advantage presence cute kitten graced us presence CSHL course 2022. function going display photo Hooper House kitten. Create new R script file RStudio add hooper_kitten . Save function hooper.R R directory. Note function requires two new packages, png package grid package. tell R package needs two packages adding following DESCRIPTION file License line (see ). , people install R package, png grid packages also installed needed.
code: love_cats <- function(love=TRUE){     if(love==TRUE){         print("I love cats!")         return(TRUE)     }     else {         print("I am not a cool person.")         return(FALSE)     } } hooper_kitten <- function() {     file_loc = system.file('images/hooper_kitten.png', package='CuteCats')     pic = png::readPNG(file_loc)     grid::grid.raster(pic) } Imports: png, grid

text: Adding documentation functions really important , future self, anyone share functions package . looks intimidating first, couple times, pretty straightforward. approach people use days document functions using roxygen package. Edit love_cats function file look like: Save file . Now, get documentation comments code actual R documentation file, run: hooper_kitten function:
code: #' Do you love cats? #' #' This function allows you to express your love of cats. #'  #' @param love Do you love cats? Defaults to TRUE. #' @keywords cats #' @examples #' love_cats() #' @export love_cats <- function(love=TRUE){     if(love==TRUE){         print("I love cats!")         return(TRUE)     }     else {         print("I am not a cool person.")         return(FALSE)     } } devtools::document() #' Hooper Kitten picture #'  #' Displays the cutest kitten at Cold Spring Harbor #' @examples #' hooper_kitten() #' @export hooper_kitten <- function() {     file_loc = system.file('images/hooper_kitten.png', package='CuteCats')     pic = png::readPNG(file_loc)     grid::grid.raster(img) }
